abstract.p: Leo Burnett Co, Chicago, and Young & Rubicam, Chicago win top honors in the 32d annual American Advertising Awards competition sponsored by the American Advertising Federation, Washington; Wieden & Kennedy, Portland, Ore, and two units of Omnicom Group also win Addys (Advertising column) (S).

block.p: Two Chicago agencies have won top honors in the 32nd annual American Advertising Awards competition sponsored by the American Advertising Federation in Washington.
Two Chicago agencies have won top honors in the 32nd annual American Advertising Awards competition sponsored by the American Advertising Federation in Washington.

The Leo Burnett Company, part of the B Com3 Group, won the Best of Show in the print category for an ad for Altoids mints, sold by the Kraft Foods unit of Philip Morris. The Chicago office of Young & Rubicam Advertising won the Best of Show in the broadcast category for a commercial for H & R Block; the account has since been placed in review and Y.& R. Chicago is not taking part.

Wieden & Kennedy in Portland, Ore., won the most awards, 10, for work for clients like AltaVista, Nike, Powerbar and Stamps.com. Two units of the Omnicom Group -- the Chicago office of DDB Worldwide and Goodby, Silverstein & Partners in San Francisco -- each won seven awards. The awards, known as Addys, will be presented during the federation's annual conference in Las Vegas on June 20-22.
